title.narrative: Increased production and strategic business planning to capitalise on value-adding opportunities

description.narrative:
The assessment team advised positively to Agriterra about a cooperation with MBOCS as it shows the right attitude to change, has growth potential, is large enough currently, has a solid reputation amongst members and other stakeholders and has the right entrepreneurial spirit. The cooperative has the ambition to grow to 1,000 members in 2022 and start processing and selling goods, which connects with the Agriterra ambitions. BHAG 2018: Increased production and productivity of maize, groundnuts and soy beans; increased membership from 368 in 2017 to 500 in 2018; reduced side-selling. BHAG 2022: Full processing of crops of 1,000 members into end products that have a strong brand in outlets in major districts in the region. The project will focus on Production, Cooperative Governance, Financial Management, Marketing, Member Commitment and Strategic Planning.
Planned activities: Support to extension officer (Production): MBOCS will recruit an Extension Officer. Agriterra will contribute to his/her salary and also a motorbike rental until a 3rd party (e.g. ILO) has come in to provide the coop with a motorbike. The expected result is increased production of soy beans and other crops. Cooperative Governance training: address governance gaps in the cooperative and increase understanding of governance at board and management level. Financial Management training: address FM gaps in the cooperative and increase understanding of FM at board and staff level. Marketing training: develop a marketing plan for the sale of soybeans, maize and groundnuts in formal market channels. Internal Capitalisation/Member Commitment training: strengthen MBOCS's internal capitalisation strategy and improve member commitment. Strategic Planning: Agriterra will organise a strategic planning workshop to guide MBOCS on developing a SMART strategic plan guiding its strategic direction towards reaching the 2022 BHAG. Vlaue Creator groundnuts: identify new business opportunities to create value in the groundnut value chain.
Increased production and productivity of maize, groundnuts and soy beans; increased membership from 368 in 2017 to 500 in 2018; reduced side-selling.
